description._content: Janaina Tschäpe will create a surrealist universe between the idea of food and seafood-science fiction and cartoon, adventure and scenery, object and décor, seduction and depth. Creature exemplifies the beauty of a magical female and portrays the essence that such animals have a dense history in art. As a sculpture, Creature, explores limits of physical and cultural dislocation and displacement; creating a sense of mystery along with a miracle of nature. Creature functions to represent an octopus as a malleable yet glamorous sexual object. On Wednesday evening, April 18, 2012, the Brooklyn Museum will host its annual fundraising gala, the Brooklyn Artists Ball. This year’s ball will celebrate women artists and recognize the fifth anniversary of the Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art. Guests will dine at table environments created for the occasion by sixteen Brooklyn women artists selected by the Museum’s curators. Each artist will transform a 40-foot-long table into a new work of art that will be on view for one night only. Brooklyn Artists Ball April 18, 2012 www.brooklynmuseum.org/calendar/event/5132
